title: Martin Luther King and Malcolm X - argument

content.question: In noting that he had “yet to engage in a direct-action campaign that was ‘well timed,’” Martin Luther King, Jr., was most likely arguing against

choices.label: African American activists who asserted that King’s tactics were taking too long to produce results
Civil Rights activists who believed that more thought should be given to the precise timing of boycotts, demonstrations, and direct actions
environmental activists who believed that the struggle for more effective conservation measures should take precedence over the Civil Rights movement
White Americans who argued that African Americans should be more patient and that civil rights should not be brought about by civil disobedience tactics

content.answer: White Americans who argued that African Americans should be more patient and that civil rights should not be brought about by civil disobedience tactics

topic.text: 8.10: The African American Civil Rights Movement (1960s)
